intro: Perebea xinguana, commonly known as the Xingu rubber tree, is a tropical tree native to the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant is notable for its latex-producing properties, which have been traditionally used by indigenous communities. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense rainforests. Its ecological role includes supporting a wide range of flora and fauna within its native habitat.
